On DATE the Government informed the ORG that in response to the pilot judgment CARDINAL federal laws had been enacted , introducing a new domestic remedy in respect of lengthy judicial proceedings and delayed enforcement of domestic judgments against the ORG . The laws entered into force on DATE ( “ the LAW ” , see part B below ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG informed the applicants in the present cases and all other applicants in the same position of the new remedy , advising them to make use of it within the DATE time - limit set by LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE Mr Fakhretdinov informed the ORG in response that he had indeed brought a relevant claim before a domestic court in accordance with the new statute .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE Mr PERSON expressed an intention to lodge such a claim but cast strong doubts as to the effectiveness of the procedure , and added that it had not been available at the time of his application to the ORG .

CARDINAL . All the applicants explicitly maintained their complaints concerning undue length of the proceedings before the ORG . Mr PERSON furthermore insisted on his other complaint ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a Federal Law no . CARDINAL-ФЗ “ On Compensation for Violation of the Right to a Trial within a Reasonable Time or ORG of a ORG within a Reasonable Time ” ( “ LAW ” ) . On DATE the ORG adopted LAW , no . CARDINAL-ФЗ , introducing a number of corresponding changes to the relevant federal laws . Both laws entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . LAW entitles a party concerned ( “ an applicant ” ) to bring an action for compensation of the violation of his or her right to a trial within a reasonable time or of the right to enforcement within a reasonable time of a judgment establishing a debt to be recovered from State budgets ( LAW , § CARDINAL ) . Such compensation can only be awarded if the alleged violation took place independently of the applicant 's own actions except those taken in the circumstances of force majeure . A breach of the statutory time - limits for examination of the case does not amount per se to a violation of the right to a trial within a reasonable time or right to enforcement of a judgment within a reasonable time ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) . A compensation award is not dependent on the competent authorities ' fault ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL sets out the rules of jurisdiction and procedure . It states in particular that a claim for compensation for excessively lengthy civil and criminal proceedings should be brought to a court of general jurisdiction , and a claim concerning commercial proceedings to a commercial court . Such a claim can also be introduced as part of an application for supervisory review of the decisions of commercial courts . This provision further sets down the conditions to be satisfied prior to lodging a claim for compensation . Thus , in the case of civil proceedings the claim should be lodged within DATE of the last judicial decision , or prior to termination of the proceedings provided that their length has exceeded DATE and the applicant has applied for their expedition in a procedure determined by statute . In the case of criminal proceedings the claim for compensation should be lodged within DATE of the entry into force of a final judicial decision , or prior to termination of the proceedings if their length has exceeded DATE and the applicant has applied for their expedition in a procedure determined by statute .

CARDINAL . A court decision granting compensation is subject to immediate enforcement ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) . It may be appealed against in accordance with the procedural legislation in force ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) . The costs of payment of compensation awards are included in the federal budget , in the budgets of federal entities and in local budgets ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . All individuals who have complained to ORG that their right to a trial within a reasonable time or to enforcement of a judgment within a reasonable time has been violated may claim compensation in domestic courts under LAW within DATE of its entry into force , provided ORG has not ruled on the admissibility of the complaint ( LAW CARDINAL ) .
